definition: to receive/to answer (the phone)/to meet or welcome sb/to connect/to catch/to join/to extend/to take one's turn on duty/to take over for sb
only used in 濟濟|济济[ji3 ji3]
to cross a river/to aid or relieve/to be of help
used in place names associated with the Ji River 濟水|济水[Ji3 Shui3]/surname Ji

sentences.english: Rural folk are increasingly bringing food to relatives in the cities.
sentences.chinese: 越來越多的農村居民給城市裏的親戚帶去接濟食物。

sentences.english: Like to do good things, and be happy?
sentences.chinese: 喜歡做善事，樂於拿財物接濟有困難的人。

sentences.english: The little girl had come upon the parish ever since her parents died.
sentences.chinese: 小姑娘父母雙亡後，就一直靠教區的接濟生活。

sentences.english: Itas very nice of you to help me.
sentences.chinese: 你來接濟我，你真是太好了。

sentences.english: Jesus wanted to heal the sick, feed the poor and teach.
sentences.chinese: 耶穌想要治癒疾病，接濟教化窮人。

sentences.english: John is willing to tide over his sister a little longer.
sentences.chinese: 約翰願意再接濟她妹妹一些時候。

sentences.english: He received them, Lin Dong enough to live comfortably after six months of life.
sentences.chinese: 因爲得到她們的接濟，董林過了半年衣食無憂的生活。

sentences.english: Invite and help some people to recall what is it in their earliest memory.
sentences.chinese: 聘請若干人接濟他們記憶他們最早的記憶是什麼。

sentences.english: Now Judas sent necessaries to them that were within.
sentences.chinese: 猶大輸送一切必需品，接濟被圍困的人。

definition: to support one's family (idiom); to have difficulty feeding a family
to eke out a living/to live from hand to mouth/to drift aimlessly
to save on food and clothing (idiom); to live frugally
to sound out the difficulties and retreat to avoid defeat (idiom); fig. to back out of an awkward situation/to get out on finding out what it's really like
to leave one's native place, esp. against one's will (idiom)
to look up and see no-one familiar (idiom); not having anyone to rely on/without a friend in the world
